meta.title: Fixing Microsoft Connection Issues on the Launcher
meta.subtitle: Complete Guide to Set Up Microsoft Authenticator
meta.description: Documentation explaining how to resolve error 400 when connecting to your Microsoft account on the Divizion Launcher, using the Microsoft Authenticator app.
meta.author: Team Divizion

content.text: This error occurs because Microsoft now requires enhanced security authentication methods for third-party applications.

blocks.caption: Figure 1: Error message when attempting to connect

content.text: Microsoft recently decided to enforce enhanced security for connections to smaller applications. It is now
to use authentication methods with enhanced security.
Microsoft no longer allows the use of simple passwords for users to connect via third-party applications. The only accepted methods are:
• Confirmation code via SMS or email
If you have already configured Microsoft Authenticator on your account, you can skip directly to Step 2: Connecting to the Launcher.

blocks.title: Installing and configuring the app
blocks.description: Follow these steps to configure Microsoft Authenticator on your Microsoft account.

steps.title: Download Microsoft Authenticator
steps.description: Install the Microsoft Authenticator app from the App Store (iOS) or Google Play Store (Android).

steps.title: Open the app
steps.description: Once the app is downloaded and installed, open it on your mobile device.

steps.title: Link your Microsoft account
steps.description: Connect your Microsoft account to the app and enable sign-in from the app.

content.text: If configuration via the app fails, you can configure authentication directly from the

blocks.title: Procedure via Microsoft website
blocks.description: Follow these steps if configuration via the app doesn't work.

steps.title: Access the security panel
steps.description: Go to the Microsoft account management site, then navigate to Security > More security options.

steps.title: Add a sign-in method
steps.description: Click on the button "Add a new way to sign in or verify".

steps.title: Select the app
steps.description: In the popup that appears, click on "Use an app" then "Quickly approve sign-in notifications on your phone".

steps.title: Follow the instructions
steps.description: A window will open explaining how to configure the Microsoft Authenticator app. Follow the on-screen instructions.

content.text: Once Microsoft Authenticator is configured, follow these steps to connect to the Divizion Launcher.

blocks.title: Connection procedure
blocks.description: Connect to your Microsoft account via the launcher using two-factor authentication.

steps.title: Start the connection process
steps.description: Click on the Microsoft sign-in button in the Divizion Launcher and enter your email address.

steps.title: Avoid entering your password
steps.description: If a window prompts you to enter your password, DO NOT ENTER IT. The probability that it will work is very low.

steps.title: Choose app authentication
steps.description: Click on one of the following options: "Use my Microsoft app", "Use Microsoft Authenticator", or "Other way to sign in".

steps.title: Select Microsoft Authenticator
steps.description: If you clicked on "Other way to sign in", select "Sign in with Authenticator" from the list of options.

steps.title: Validate the code
steps.description: A code will appear on screen. Open the Microsoft Authenticator app on your phone, enter the same code and validate.

blocks.caption: Figure 2: Select the option to use Microsoft Authenticator
Figure 3: Enter this code in your Microsoft Authenticator app

content.text: If the Microsoft Authenticator option is not available, you can use other similar methods such as signing in with a code received on your phone or by email. These options are also very likely to work.
Once the code is validated in the Microsoft Authenticator app, the connection should complete automatically and you will be signed in to your Microsoft account in the Divizion Launcher.

We strongly recommend never entering your password in unknown programs. Always prefer two-factor authentication via an app or message. This helps bypass keyloggers in malicious programs and protects your account.
